Lucas, KY 42156 USA

Description

Barren River Lake State Resort Park is a water-lovers paradise surrounded by forested, rolling hills. The resort is located near Kentuckyâ€™s famous cave area, which includes Mammoth Cave National Park, the longest cave system in the world!

The 18-Hole golf course at Barren River Lake State Resort Park offers a beautiful but challenging 18-holes of golf that is sure to offer an exciting round of golf to beginners and experts alike. The golf course is surrounded by beautiful views of Barren River Lake State Resort Park and breathtaking overlooks of Barren River Lake.

The setting is ideal for an individual, golf group, scrambles and tournaments. The Golf Pro Shop is equipped with food, drink and a selection of golf merchandise for golfers of all ages.

We are currently seeking an individual for the position of Landscape Gardener in our golf maintenance department. The right person will be caring for and maintaining all existing gardens, bushes, and trees on the park. The landscape gardener is also a member of the golf maintenance team, ensuring that the golf course is mowed, trimmed, watered and maintained on a daily basis ensuring that the parks golf course is the best that it can be. We are also looking for someone that can deliver the best customer service possible to our wonderful golfers. If you are a team player and enjoy being outdoors, working in a beautiful setting, golfing, planning, greeting people and delivering great customer service then this is a full-time position that might be for you.

If you join the team at Barren River Lake and with the state of Kentucky, you will be offered an excellent benefits and retirement package as one of your many benefits both tangible and intangible.

Benefits

Barren River Lake is a part of the Kentucky Department of Parks and offers an outstanding compensation and benefits package for full-time employees, including:

Health insurance  Retirement plan  Paid vacation  Paid holidaysFamily Park familiarization at other state parks

This is an excellent opportunity for the right individual to be a part of a challenging environment and critical team member to help this State Park not only maintain but improve its offerings to our guests.

Minimum Requirements

EDUCATION: High school graduate.

EXPERIENCE, TRAINING, OR SKILLS: Must have two years of experience in grounds maintenance, golf course greens keeping, landscaping, farming, or other related experience.

Substitute EDUCATION for EXPERIENCE: An associate degree or technical training in horticulture or a related field will substitute for the required experience on a year-for-year basis. A Kentucky Certified Nurseryman, Certified International Society of Arboriculture (ISA) Arborist or other trade certification will substitute for the required experience.

Substitute EXPERIENCE for EDUCATION: NONE

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS (AGE, LICENSURE, REGULATION, ETC.): Must possess a valid driver's license prior to employment in this job classification. Must maintain any required licensure(s), certification(s), or other credentials for the length of employment in this job classification. Employing agency is responsible for ensuring employee possesses and maintains required licensure(s), certification(s) or other credentials.

Working Conditions

Work outdoors in all weather conditions. Operate power equipment. Exposed to substances commonly associated with landscaping (pesticides, fertilizers, etc.). Exposed to loud noises and sharp objects.

Probationary Period

This job has an initial and promotional probationary period of 6 months, except as provided in KRS 18A.111.

If you have questions about this advertisement, please contact Danny Salllee at Danny.Sallee@ky.gov or (270) 646-2151.

An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
